_exec_summary.SummaryText:
May 2024
Risk Management Plan
Executive Summary

The Risk Management Program at the Arclin USA LLC, Springfield, Oregon facility, incorporates a
Risk Management Plan that assimilates the following elements:

Health, Safety and Environmental Pledge
Arclin is committed to implementing and sustaining a world-class health, safety, and environmentally conscientious workplace culture, built upon the foundation of a well-trained and educated work force.  

Arclin is dedicated to achieving a zero incident workplace and continually reducing its impact on environmental and ecological receptors using management and science-based solutions. We strive at all times to ensure that health and safety of our employees and the community is our first priority. 

This commitment begins with the top-down accountability and bottom-up communication stretching beyond the Arclin borders from our suppliers to our customers, and our communities. 

We believe that every employee's responsibility is to perform their duties consistent with the belief that all accidents are preventable. 


Facility Information;
The primary activity at the Arclin USA Springfield site is the production of formaldehyde solutions for the production of formaldehyde-based thermosetting resins which are used in engineered wood adhesive applications, such as plywood and OSB. The Springfield site has three reactors from which formaldehyde is produced in a continuous process from methanol.  At present, one of the formaldehyde processes, SF-1, is offline with no plans to restart it in future. The maximum quantity of formaldehyde stored in one vessel is 50,000 gallons at a concentration of 52% by weight. 

Aqua ammonia is used in the resin production process. The maximum quantity of aqua ammonia stored in one vessel is 104,580 lbs at a concentration of 30% by weight. Resins are produced in batch operations and are shipped to customers by truck.
